intro: Linaria pontica, commonly known as the Persian toadflax, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region and parts of Central Asia. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant features slender, branched stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are bright yellow and resemble those of the common toadflax, with two lips and five petals. Linaria pontica is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and fields.
